conclusion: Resistance R₁ = 20Ω, Internal resistance of motor R₂ = 10Ω, When switch is open, current I₀ = 0.5A, When switch is closed, voltage across circuit remains unchanged, Need to find relationship between circuit power P and 15W
When the switch is open, the motor is disconnected from the circuit. The current only flows through R₁ and the ammeter.
Using Ohm's Law: U = I₀ × R₁, U = 0.5A × 20Ω = 10V, So the voltage across the circuit is 10V.
When the switch is closed, the motor (with its internal resistance) is connected in parallel with R₁.
The equivalent resistance of the parallel combination is: R_eq = (R₁ × R₂) ÷ (R₁ + R₂) = (20Ω × 10Ω) ÷ (20Ω + 10Ω) = 200Ω ÷ 30Ω ≈ 6.67Ω
Since the voltage remains unchanged at 10V: I_total = U ÷ R_eq = 10V ÷ 6.67Ω = 1.5A
The total power consumed is: P = U × I_total = 10V × 1.5A = 15W
Current through R₁: I₁ = U ÷ R₁ = 10V ÷ 20Ω = 0.5A
Current through motor: I₂ = U ÷ R₂ = 10V ÷ 10Ω = 1.0A
Power in R₁: P₁ = I₁² × R₁ = (0.5A)² × 20Ω = 5W
Power in motor: P₂ = I₂² × R₂ = (1.0A)² × 10Ω = 10W
The electric power P consumed by the circuit is equal to 15W.
